Message.Msg: Hello dillysnana, I am from Dell Social Media and Community. I am sorry to know your issue was not resolved though you had shipped the system to Dell for repair. Please private message me the service tag or the express service code of your system, with your name and contact details. I will be happy to escallate this and resolve your system issue ASAP. Dell-Niranjan

Topic.Title: GDOT upgraded from Neutral to Overweight, Sell DELL & Buy GDOT

Message.Msg: Won't it be wise for small to medium investors to sell DELL and buy GDOT whose PEG ratio is just about 0.40, which is just 1/3rd that of DELL ... Recently Piper Jaffray has upgraded GDOT from Neutral to Overweight and the price target is $20/share ... With Sallie Mae officially launching a new "My Flex Card" prepaid debit MasterCard (MA), in partnership with Green Dot (GDOT) ... GDOT has rocketed up into $30/share takeover target ... Those holding 25% of GDOT float in short position would most probably be burned beyond recognition ... and GOT might get a ballistic run up from that itself

Message.Title: Sterne Agee upgraded Dell (NASDAQ: DELL) to buy
Message.Msg: Sterne Agee upgraded Dell (NASDAQ: DELL) to buy after share hit their $15 price target, declining 33% since their downgrade in mid-February versus a 2% decline in both the S&P 500 and NASDAQ. downside likely limited with shares trading at 7x CY13 EPS (5x ex. net cash)."

Message.Title: An analyst at Topeka Capital upgraded shares of Dell (NASDAQ: DELL) from Hold to Buy Wednesday afternoon following last night's news the company will begin paying a dividend. The firm's price target was raised from $13.50 to $15.75.

Message.Title: Contrarian play... Sold my AAPL and bought DELL @10.49
Message.Msg: I have two IPAD's, a IPOD and an ancient DELL desktop and laptop. I like Windows 8... and it seems like DELL has some products out ahead of HPQ. I WISH that my IPAD's could do more... and they will never replace a computer... so I will get a new laptop or desktop. I also like the focus to enterprise that DELL is taking. Their overall profits will be steering more and more away from commodity PC's. I also am looking at getting in on DELL at a multi-year low, 3% dividend... and a stock that is trading at around 5 times forward earnings (taking out the net cash).

Message.Title: Is this interesting or what?
Message.Msg: Michale Dellâ€™s net worth is $14.6 billion and Dell is worth $18 billion. With this kind of wealth, if Michael Dell truly believes in his company, he can take it private and re-energize it and come back stronger. Just have to believe that he has something up his sleeve as no one would like to see the company that you started go down in shambles! One more thing to ponder is, who is selling at these levels... Mind-boggling!

Topic.Title: Contrarian play... Sold my AAPL and bought DELL @10.49

Message.Msg: Hmm, definitely contrarian. Remember, the dividend can go away as fast as it showed up. Divvy was a desperation move to prop up PPS. The PC market is definitely dead. PCs last longer and there is nothing on the horizon to make them more attractive. Windows 8? Octa yawn. Maybe at eight bucks, it's a buy. DELL insiders simply want to prop this POS up so they can issue founders' options and dump, IMO. Seen it a million times.
